Half life 2 had  alot of expectations for me in my book. It was a long time since I played Half-Life, but still vaguely remember  from 1999 how tricky, difficult and fun it was.  SO as I begna to play this I was in the mind set that the game would be excellent, which it WAS!  Half life 2  I think brings a hold another whole  prepective to Half-Life in that it in coporates the fundametals of the first game, but allows it to expand greatly to another realms and new exiciting maps.   What I was really impressed with is that the games 's story doesn't get corny like most video game storyies line do. This game is well sought out and hopefully they will release a third. Well like to tell more but you have to play and see!~
Amazing storyline, great characters (well, some are fegets), fun arsenary to play with, and an overall fabulous game 666/10

This game is one of the best Steam games you will ever play.in fact, i think it is one of the best Valve games out there and should be played since it never gets old and its story line is spectacuilar!

It is very difficult to combine an amazing story with an action/horror/adventure game; but if there is any game out there that has perfected this balance, by god it's this game. Very few games have I replayed for story, but this one I've lost count of. Valve has out done themselves and raised the bar immensely.
This game has a good story, excellent action, the graphics are good, it has vey good missions, and it's like a life time game. One of my favorite games on steam. Buy it!

3: the games details are amazing and the gameplay is awseome
over all this game is so far the best game i have ever played!

Experience on Linux so far:

- Mouse sensitivity issues, may have been resolved now.

The game:
You know what it is! Half-life was and still is epic, although I think it's time for Gordon to rest and let Valve focus on entirely new games. Not everyone agrees and I know a large crowd of people are feverishly waiting for HL3. Hopefully, it will have a Linux port on the same release date as the other versions and I will happily preorder to make that happen.
By current standards, this is an old game and comparing it to newer titles it does show. Still a "need to own" title.
I still think HL1 was better and more groundbreaking back in it's day, but hey, HL is HL.

What can be said about Half Life 2?  A hella lot.   Its a shining example of what solid FPS games should offer.   Without placing all the glory on gun fights, it instead challenges the mind with often simple, and sometimes not, mazes and obstacles, that most run n' guns today have forgotten all about.

This game is simply amazing, even though in this mans opinion, it will always be shadowed by HL1.

From my point of view, this is not better than the first Half-Life game. This game pays too much attention to the physics engine, the puzzles are often physics related which can be fun, but I found them boring, useless and frustrating sometimes.

Don't get me wrong, I like the game, but not as much as the first one. This also has a few "Episodes", those episodes are not that long but quite fun. Sometimes I feel Valve did not pay too much attention for difficulty, I found it easier than the first Half-Life.

The soundtrack is quite good, but the fact that the NPCs control you, and tell you what to do... well... when I first played it, I thought it's going to be the same as in the first Half-Life. In Half-Life 1, Valve did not force you to listen conversations (that much) and they provided you some kind of freedom which Half-Life 2 fails to give us. There are parts where I just want to ripp off my ears and poke my eyes because the conversations takes too long.

Although they made some better AI, the game itself is not better at all... on the contrary, a bit worse because of the above. As the story continues in HL2, I recommend to play HL1 first.

Simplemente es el mejor FPS que se ha hecho hasta el día de hoy...

Da igual que algunos BF o COD tengan mil tios en pantalla pegándose tiros, o que Bioshock presuma de su ambientación, HL2 fue el primero en mostrar que dentro de un FPS puede haber algo más, que los tiros quedan en segundo lugar y que un videojuego puede ir más allá.

Lo mejor.
Juego con unos graficos competentes incluso 10 años despues de su salida, un lore muy llamativo para los fans de Sci-Fi y el mejor diseño de niveles en un FPS.

Half life two is obviously one of the best games ever, and I can confirm that.

Half Life is one of the first PC games I owned.  I had it when I plugged a power cable into a lan card and fried it.  Oh young dumb PC accidents.  Half Life 2 is a build upon an already amazing franchise.  One that spawned Counter-Strike and Day of Defeat from free Half Life mods to actual stand alone games that were sold in stores.  Half Life 2 is an incredible game with stunning graphics and great AI - for its time.  

The gameplay is fun and with the use of Developer Mode, players that are playing the game through for a second, third, or fourth time can enable fun gravity settings or thousands of other commands.  The story line in the game itself is the classic FPS Hero vs The World.  

I would rate this game a 9.2/10 because it is still a classic, a benchmark to gaming, a sequel to one of the best games ever made and still one of the highest META rated games in the world.  Half Life 2 is worth the few dollars to purchase - as well as all of the other Valve titles.

Que más se puede decir sobre Half-Life  2 y sus episodios. Es una obra maestra, todo el detalle de los niveles, la forma en que cambian de atmosfera entre un capitulo a otro es genial. Puedes estar dentro de un laboratorio, en un bosque, en una ciudad abandonada, en nido de hormigas y nunca sentirás algo fuera de lugar. La ambientación es perfecta. Los personajes carismáticos. Un clásico que sabe envejecer muy bien. 
Lo malo… tendrás que esperar media vida para ver el episodio 3 tal vez incluso más para poder jugar Half-Life 3.

[b]Half-Life 2[b]
[b]Suite logique de la première saga Half-Life 1[/b]
Cette deuxième monture adopte une approche minimalistes pour le développement de l’histoire, elle offre un monde plus riche dans les atmosphères et d’engagements qui vous aspire inexorablement en plein dans le jeu.
Combiné avec les éléments d’un roman de gameplay (un des premiers jeux traditionnels pour faire bon usage de la physique dans le gameplay), un ensemble de caractères au sommet sympathiques matchs avec la bien aimé Alyx Vance, sur tout le jeu un combat bien rythmé, ce qui contribue à faire de Half-Life 2 un classique grand de tous les temps…
De plus il vous ouvre les portes sur des mods hors du commun…
História Incrível,os doi ultimos jogos como continuação,seguem o mesmo rumo. Aguardo continuação a anos...
This game was pretty much the entertainment equivalent of riding a unicorn down a mountain while drinking from a goblet filled with the laughter of chilldren.

Well...what's there to say what haven't been said a thousand times about this game ? In my opinion , it's still one of the best single player games out there, it basically has everything you want from a game. Good Story, nice background stories/information , charakters with souls. NO AUTOHEAL which is great because it's more challenging that way and Last but not least...a GREAT and ongoing mod support which ranges from Gameplay tweaks and graphic mods, to total conversions and whole new game genres (Gmod ;) ) The demo is actually just a tech demo which doesn't really resemble the great gameplay elements. And c'mon. 10 bucks for a big milestone in video game history ? ;) Go BUY IT ! And buy the episodes too. And don't howl like some horny dogs about Half-Life 3 because let's be honest. Valve WILL definetely Release it. But to understand better why they don't say anything about it google : Gabe Newell Let's talk about Half-Life 3 ... a great open letter from Gaben :D

Well...is there anything left to say ? Yes...HAVE FUN !!

El juego que marcó un punto de inflexión en el mundo del videojuego, lamentablemente, mi experiencia jugable tuvo lugar ya mas de 5 años despues del lanzamiento del titulo, pero aún así, me pareció de lo mejor que había jugado a lo largo de mi historia gamer, nunca es tarde para jugar a esta obra maestra, no envejece, es simplemente un juego que se situa en esa liga superior en la cual, dentro de cientos de años, se les recordará, como recordamos libros de Shakespeare o Cervantes.

Quick Summary:
An experience worth having. A foundation for all FPS to follow. Must play for everyone.

Longer Review:
A great milestone in the progression of First Person Shooters.
Gameplay is intuitive in the controls, navigation through from start to finish, audio and visual hints. The dificulty, pace and scale progression are fantastic and make for great replayability. While all this may seem standard in any modern FPS, this is where it was originally mastered.
Story is huge in this game. It follows on from the original, Half-Life, set in a future after the events of the original game advanced from the on-site effects to a global change. You are the central character in potentially fixing the situation. The techniques used to tell the story are all through observation. Your only input is with your weapon or to prompt the action of a device or NPC. Exploring or speed running through the game, it's an experience with a lot of depth.
Graphically this game has aged, though it was ground breaking when it was released. The model rigging and animation was beyond anything else for real-time rendering. Now, it's less detailed but still better executed than most games on the market. The visuals in this may cause mild headaches at points, but that's probably because you're still playing after 10hrs without grabbing a drink.

Half-Life 2 has to be one of the best games ever made, and yes, everyone seems to say that...but it's true. The biggest down-side to this game was me, admitting I could have played this for years now, but stubbornly I ignored all the high praise and did not buy it until recently. Even for 2014 the game feels and plays just as nicely as many current titles (if not better), and the true greats transcend time and technology. You have vast choices for difficuly, play-ability and so on, yet it gives you the feeling of real-time danger and urgency and ways to figure a way out that never gets old or feels out-dated. It gives you great FPS feel, RPG feel and is just as relevant as a game today as it was when released, and there are times when I lost sleep trying to figure out in my head ways to get past a puzzling stage or two. For those of you going back-and-forth on whether to buy this game even if it came out a near-decade ago...at least get the game to see how when a game is done right, release date doesn't matter. Plus, you get to see the influence this series had on countless games that have been released since. An absolute work of art, for the true art of gaming.

There is something very special about this game, and that would be that it is flat out creepy. There were many times where I would get very stressed out, but it was because there were many dangerous situations, like carefully shuffling along the bottom support beams of a large bridge while being shot at. Of course this was my second FPS experience after Portal so having an actual gun this time around was new for me.
I could go on for hours about how wonderful this game is. It's got humour, excitment, danger, freaky monster zombie crabs and holy cow those things sound awful. 

Helpful tip: Don't play Ravenholm at 4AM.

Best. Shooter. Ever.

Though Half-Life 2 is a rather "old" game in the gaming community, it still is a great experience. Gunplay, movements, and weapons are what makes up some of the best things about the game. Its storyline is as good as any other, but with very choppy and boring dialogue it really throws all of it off. Some of the characters are quite dull or annoying along with not very surprising plot twists. Also some of the levels you really want to be over soon last for 2 hours with cool concepts at first with interesting vehicles, but gets overused in the first 15 minutes or so and becomes a chore. Those levels sre few with many other more action filled ones.

Now for the good things, like all the artfully done gameplay. What the game lacks in character, dialogue, plot, and vehicles it makes up for in its always altering enemy and weapon types. The arsenal they give you is one to never get tired of using, for it has great diversity. Most the on ground missions are fun and intense with some little puzzles here and there that really get your brains gears going. All the prop dynamics, movements, and gravitational animations are so fun to mess with, as you can grab things and throw them along with breaking them. With the gravity gun it is an amazing tool to fling yout surroundings at your enemies. Its gunplay is simple and fun along with its devastating weapon attachments (such as the grenade launcher and proton launcher). While in combat there is always some kind of twist they throw at you to keep things sparked up. Altogether, the gameplay is extravagent, its storyline lacking, so play it for the fun of it, not the content.

Where do we begin with this Game? Not only one of Valve's most successful Game franchises ever, but one of the most Notable game titles of all existence. Half-Life 2 is the sequeal in a deep and complex, Half-Life; and continues its renowned graphics, gameplay and storyline; packed with backstory, Easter Eggs complex obsticles, battles, etc. If Half-Life 2 doesn't make it on the list of Top 5 Best Valve Games ever contrived, I don't know the gaming community anymore. Recommended beyond belief. 1000/10
